About

Hello — I’m Drishti, a front-end developer focused on building inclusive web experiences. I enjoy translating design into accessible interfaces using semantic HTML, thoughtful ARIA patterns, and performance-conscious CSS. I collaborate closely with designers and product teams to make sure that the final product is not only visually appealing, but also usable by people with diverse abilities.

Instructor notes: accessibility & semantic checklist

  • Landmark elements used: header, nav, main, aside, footer.
  • Skip link present for keyboard users. Verify it becomes visible on focus for keyboard-only testing.
  • Form fields have explicit label associations and required indicators. Confirm screen reader announcement for required fields.
  • Ensure color contrast and focus outlines meet WCAG AA for body text and interactive elements.
  • Test keyboard-only navigation through the form and site links (Tab order, focus management).
  • Images include descriptive alt text; decorative images should have empty alt attributes if added later.
